com.mumfrey.webprefs

Class DummyOfflineWebPreferences

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mumfrey.webprefs.DummyOfflineWebPreferences
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IWebPreferences

    public class DummyOfflineWebPreferences
extends java.lang.Object
    No-op webpreferences set which is returned for nonlocal players when the client is running in offline mode.

    • Method Detail

      • poll

        public void poll()
        Description copied from interface: IWebPreferences
        Calling poll() is essentially the same as calling IWebPreferences.request(java.lang.String) for every key currently in the collection, this method can essentially be used to refresh the entire collection and should be called only in exceptional circumstances. It is called automatically by the preferences manager when connecting to a server.

        Invoking poll() causes all of the values in the collection to be requested as a single batch

      • has

        public boolean has(java.lang.String key)
        Description copied from interface: IWebPreferences
        Get whether this collection has a value for the specified key, and triggers asnchronous retrieval if not
        Parameters:
        key - Key to check for
        Returns:
        true if collection has specified key

      • get

        public java.lang.String get(java.lang.String key)
        Description copied from interface: IWebPreferences
        Get the value for the specified key from this collection. Invoking this method causes asynchronous retrieval of the specified key if it is not found in the collection and returns null. If the key is found, then the value is returned and the collection remains unchanged.
        Returns:
        value or null

      • get

        public java.lang.String get(java.lang.String key,
                            java.lang.String defaultValue)
        Description copied from interface: IWebPreferences
        Works exactly like get(String), including triggering asynchronous retrieval of the property if the property is not found in the collection, except that if the property is not found the specified defaultValue is returned instead of returning null.
        Returns:
        value or default

      • isReadOnly

        public final boolean isReadOnly()
        Description copied from interface: IWebPreferences
        Get whether this collection is read-only. Only the player's local preferences are writable. Any attempt to write to a read-only collection will throw a ReadOnlyPreferencesException.
        Specified by:
        isReadOnly in interface IWebPreferences

      • request

        public void request(java.lang.String key)
        Description copied from interface: IWebPreferences
        Indicate to the set that the value specified by key is required an should be fetched from the server in the next batch. In general, consumers should use get() or has() to access the values in this collection, and expect that the collection will manage fetching the values from the server as part of the normal update cycle. However this method has two uses:

        • You may choose to call IWebPreferences.request(java.lang.String) when a handle to a preferences set is obtained, to indicate to the preferences set that you will require the value in the future and it should attempt to fetch the value so that it is ready for queries against the set later.
        • You may wish to indicate to the set that it should request an updated value from the server for a key which it already has (normally values are cached indefinitely).

        In both cases, calls to request() should generally be limited to periodic request for values, to avoid constantly polling the server for values, and potentially running foul of request throttling at the server side

        Specified by:
        request in interface IWebPreferences
        Parameters:
        key - key to request from the server

      • request

        public void request(java.lang.String... keys)
        Description copied from interface: IWebPreferences
        Works exactly as IWebPreferences.request(String) but allows multiple values to be requested in a single invocation
        Specified by:
        request in interface IWebPreferences
        Parameters:
        keys - keys to request

      • request

        public void request(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> keys)

        Works exactly as IWebPreferences.request(String) but allows multiple values to be requested in a single invocation
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • commit

        public void commit(boolean force)
        Description copied from interface: IWebPreferences
        Similar to IWebPreferences.poll() except for property writes instead of property reads. Under normal circumstances it should not be necessary to call this method, since commits are handled asychronously by the update loop. However it can be used to forcibly commit even "clean" values to the server. This is useful if you wish to ensure that values on the server be set to match the current values in the collection, regardless of comodification elsewhere.
        Specified by:
        commit in interface IWebPreferences
        Parameters:
        force - If set to false, only dirty properties are batched. If true, all properties are batched.

      • set

        public void set(java.lang.String key,

        Description copied from interface: IWebPreferences
        Sets a value in the collection and marks it for asynchronous commit to the server.
        Specified by:

      • remove

        public void remove(java.lang.String key)
        Description copied from interface: IWebPreferences
        Remove a key from this collection. Marks the key to be deleted from the server as well.
        Specified by:
        remove in interface IWebPreferences
